title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.5 - Eligible activities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.5 - Eligible activities

State Regulations

The following activities are generally those for which
matching funds may be provided to regional high technology development
organizations: (a) sponsor and conduct
conferences and studies, collect and disseminate information, and issue
periodic reports relating to scientific and technological research, development
and education in the State; (b) prepare and periodically issue a register of scientific and technological
research facilities in the State; (c) provide direct business and technical
assistance to small and emerging science and technology-oriented businesses in
order to strengthen and expand their operations, and facilitate their applying
for Federal research grants, and State or Federal procurement contracts, including providing information on the availability of such grants and
contracts; (d) collect and
disseminate information on financial, technical, marketing management and other
services available to small and emerging science and technology-oriented
businesses on a free or for-hire basis from universities, private for-profit
businesses, and nonprofit organizations; (e) establish a focal point for the
dissemination of information regarding inventions for the benefit of inventors
interested in having their ideas developed and commercialized for entrepreneurs
interested in the commercialization of new products and processes; and
(f) other activities as set
forth in Public Authorities Law section 3102-d and the request for proposals
issued by the office as approved by the office. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 21

5901.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
